title: Zero-dimensional tensor.tolist() returns float
body_html:
Hello!

import torch
print(torch.FloatTensor([3.15]).squeeze().tolist())
print(type(torch.FloatTensor([3.15]).squeeze().tolist()).__name__)

prints

3.1500000953674316
float

Seems like zero-dimensional tensors (i.e. scalars introduced in torch 0.4) have a bit confusing behavior of the tolist method: it returns the value itself not wrapped to list

Is it bug or expected behavior?

Thank you!

body:
Hello!

```python
import torch
print(torch.FloatTensor([3.15]).squeeze().tolist())
print(type(torch.FloatTensor([3.15]).squeeze().tolist()).__name__)
```
prints
```
3.1500000953674316
float
```

Seems like zero-dimensional tensors (i.e. scalars introduced in torch 0.4) have a bit confusing behavior of the tolist method: it returns the value itself not wrapped to list

Is it bug or expected behavior?

Thank you!
